summary: Project to add a dedicated admin login page and customer authentication. Admin uses a separate password-based login at /#/admin with access to manage product details; customers log in via email or phone with OTP verification.
architectural_notes: Admin authentication should be separate from principal/Internet Identity and use password-based login for a single admin account.
Customer authentication should support email or phone number identifiers with OTP verification flow.
Admin route should be /#/admin and show editable product management UI only after successful admin login.

existing_features.title: Replace the current Internet Identity-based protection for the /admin route so that https://beemedha-3zg.caffeine.xyz/#/admin becomes a dedicated password-based admin login page (not Internet Identity). After successful login, allow access to the existing admin pages (dashboard, products, news, logo, access) without prompting for Internet Identity.

Add a customer authentication flow that allows customers to log in using either email or phone number and verify with an OTP challenge. Provide UI screens for: entering email/phone, entering OTP, and showing logged-in customer state.

Ensure the route configuration and guards in frontend/src/App.tsx are updated so that /admin and /admin/* use the new password-admin guard, while the rest of the site continues to function normally under hash routing.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create dedicated admin login page at https://beemedha-3zg.caffeine.xyz/#/admin using separate password-based single admin account
Admin portal functionality to add/edit/delete product details on the website after admin login

Implement a single admin account authentication mechanism using the provided admin credentials: username "Thejas Kinnigoli", email "thejasumeshpoojary7@gmail.com", password "78982qwertyuiop". Update all admin-only backend operations used by the admin UI (at minimum: create/update/delete product, create/delete product update, update logo, view contact submissions, seed products) so they authorize using the new password-admin session (or equivalent) rather than requiring the caller principal to have the #admin role via Internet Identity.
